I wish I was on during the stream, so I could tell him how to fix the wing problem...

Here's what I think...
They wanted to move in symmetry, but one wasn't allowed to move in one direction because of the options that was set.
The fix for this would to...
Remove the broken one from symmetry, and Activate reverse rotation.


Probably easier and faster to do than adding them on individually, putting them in the same position symmetrically using the move tool combined with snap, and then going to the action groups, clicking the hotkey, inverting the correct one, and then go back to build.

Has anyone ever asked this: how much quicker can the journey to Mars be when the Starship does not waste its fuel to launch from Earth orbit but instead it would be accelerated by one, two or even more Starship booster stages? All the fuel in Starship could then later be used for harder braking for Mars, so the overall travel speed could be higher. My question is: how much time could be saved? Would it be worth it?
